I recommend Katharine Hayhoe’s talk, "The most important thing you can do to fight climate change: talk about it" (Talk ID 29968).

Why: the talk combines practical everyday actions with communication strategies. The metadata description says Hayhoe shows how to "connect over shared values" and that conversation is key. From the transcript she lists concrete lifestyle steps — "eating local, eating lower down the food chain and reducing food waste" — and describes how she reduces her own footprint (the biggest part "is my travel... I carefully collect my invitations" and has "transitioned nearly three-quarters of the talks I give to video"). She also emphasizes that "we need to talk about what's already happening today" and that "that hope begins with a conversation, today."

Talk details (from the provided TED data):
- Speaker: Katharine Hayhoe
- Title: The most important thing you can do to fight climate change: talk about it
- Event: TEDWomen 2018
- URL: https://www.ted.com/talks/katharine_hayhoe_the_most_important_thing_you_can_do_to_fight_climate_change_talk_about_it/

If you want a short, actionable mix of daily personal steps plus how to talk about climate with others, this is the best match in the provided TED data.
